data.title: Honor Roll of Donors
data.text:
The Crystal Arch Society

The Crystal Arch Society, recognizing gifts of $10 million and above, is named for the University of Georgiaâs most recognizable symbol and the main entrance to campus, the Arch. Erected in the 1850s, the Arch is UGAâs most revered landmark, patterned after the great seal of the state of Georgia.

Loading namesâ¦

The Abraham Baldwin Society

The Abraham Baldwin Society, recognizing gifts of $5 million and above, is named for the legendary Georgia statesman, educator, and founder of the University of Georgia. Abraham Baldwin wrote UGAâs charter, the first ever written and adopted for a statesupported public university.

Loading namesâ¦

The 1785 Society

The 1785 Society, recognizing cumulative gifts of $1 million and above, is named for the year that the University of Georgia was chartered by the Georgia General Assembly and pays homage to UGAâs impressive history and tradition of achievement as the birthplace of public higher education in America.

Loading namesâ¦

Is your name missing?

This section includes Cumulative Giving Societies and Heritage Society members who made qualifying gifts that were processed as of June 30, 2021. There may be reasons that you are not listed in the section you expected or are not listed at all:

You made your qualifying gift after June 30, 2021.

You gave more before June 30, 2021, than you realize; your name may be in the next giving level.

You made a pledge instead of an outright gift; this list reflects gifts received.

Your planned gift is not documented by the UGA Foundation, or you have withdrawn your planned gift between July 1, 2020, and June 30, 2021.

If your name was omitted in error or if you have questions, please contact us toll-free at 1-888-268-5442, or email honroll@uga.edu.
